item.title: China's TCL out to revive BlackBerry smartphones
China's TCL out to revive BlackBerry smartphones
item.description: [AFP] - Chinese electronics company TCL Corporation was at CES with a plan to revive BlackBerry handsets knocked from the mobile phone throne by Apple and Google. TCL is putting its market clout behind the design, manufacture and marketing of a new portfolio of BlackBerry smartphones, trusting that its solid position in the market will renew faith in the brand. "What sells a product is confidence in your underlying capabilities and that there is a future," said Steve Cistulli, general manager for TCL Communication Technology Holdings Limited of North America.

item.title: BlackBerry reports 3Q loss
BlackBerry results show progress on transition to software
item.description: [AFP] - BlackBerry posted better-than-expected third quarter results Tuesday, showing it is making headway in its transformation into a software and services company after abandoning in-house manufacturing of smartphones. The Waterloo, Ontario-based firm's software revenues jumped to $160 million in the three months ended November 30, while hardware sales plummeted. Chief Executive John Chen, meanwhile, reaffirmed an annual growth target of 30 percent for software sales.

Switching gears, Canada's BlackBerry to open autonomous vehicle hub
Blackberry says China's TCL to make BlackBerry-branded devices
item.description: [Reuters] - The devices made by TCL, which also makes Alcatel-branded mobile devices, will be coupled with BlackBerry's security software and service suite, the company said on Thursday. BlackBerry is betting its future on the more profitable business of making software and managing mobile devices after largely ceding the smartphone market to rivals such as Apple Inc (AAPL.O) and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd <005930.KS>.
